content: broken rib cowl *k2 p2* to end of round repeat * to * for 5 rounds by a twist of yarn body switch to a 6 0mm needle r1 knit r2 *k1 p1* repeat * to * until end of round repeat r1 and r2 until you have approximately 40 - 44 row there will be approx 20-21 purl bumps up the column or about 8 if you altered the ribbing length or cowl length make sure you have enough yarn for the ribbing and bind off finishing switch to a 5 0mm needle *k2 p2* to end of round repeat * to * for 5 rounds bind off in pattern tip try using a 6 0mm needle to bind off it will give you a wee bit more here s a quick and easy cowl worked in one skein of malabrigo slack and create a slightly looser bind off for flexibility mecha it is perfect for snuggling into on cold days cut yarn leaving at least a 6 tail using a darning needle weave the materials tail into remaining stitches and pull snuggly together weave in any other 1 skein of malabrigo mecha or minimum of 120m /130y of chunky weight ends you can choose to block the cowl or just enjoy the coziness right away yarn stay warm 5 0mm and 6 0 mm 16 circular needles or 40 circular for magic loop stitch marker s darning needle instructions using the long-tail method cast on 80 stitches using the 6 0mm needle join your work in the round being careful not to twist your stitches 3915 31 st vernon bc and place a marker at the beginning of the round www atwistofyarn com ribbing switch to a 5 0mm needle
